New Records: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 38 points, the highest by a Grizzlies player in the game.
Desmond Bane scored 31 points, contributing to the Grizzlies' victory.
Kevin Durant led the Suns with 29 points and 10 rebounds.
Key Match Events: John Konchar's three-point play with 1:05 left gave the Grizzlies a 113-106 lead.
Devin Booker's return after a five-game absence and his 16 points and nine assists were significant contributions for the Suns.
Pre-Game Insights: The Grizzlies played without Ja Morant and Zach Edey due to injuries.
Jusuf Nurkic served the second game of his suspension for his involvement in a fight.
Bradley Beal left the game with a left hip contusion.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns lost for the sixth time in seven games, struggling despite Booker's return.
The Grizzlies won despite missing two starters, showing resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: 54 fouls were called in the game with 58 free throws attempted.
Jaylen Wells scored 11 points as the Grizzlies won without two starters.
Others: The game was tightly contested, with no player fouling out.
